reviewText: While not exactly expecting 19XX quality (or Raiden, Sonic Wings, Twin Hawk or similar games) Aces of the Luftwaffe" did not manage to get the most basic things right that I am looking for in a shmup. Decent music and good pixelart aside
date: the game itself is rather crappy. You get to choose from up to 3 different fighters (two must be bought with ingame-currency and aren't available from the start) that suffer from being interesting or fun to play - lacking any clever playstyle. Each stage is more or less the same
recommended: the game tries to drown your fighter in projectiles and enemy planes that fill up the the screen real bad. Lacking the firepower to clear the screen and missing proper smartbombs
hoursPlayed: there are many frustrating moments to be had when you get hit and have no clue how and why. Enemy "patterns" are seemingly random too - putting emphasis on the HELL in bullet-hell. I guess the developers knew
voteText: which is why they gave the plane some sort of autoheal or at least a threshhold before taking permanent damage (which can be repaired by picking up items). The other power-ups are rather unspectular
helpfulPercent: though I do like the wingmen - but that idea isn't exactly new or innovative.\n\nI had the most fun with the boss battles
votesHelpful: being the stages that were most competent at feeling properly "shmup". But everything else (including grinding currency to modfiy the fighters (which in turn makes the game incredibly hard if you spend too much money on speed-upgrades)) isn't very well thought out or much fun. The game didn't even bother with some kind of ending or outro after the final boss. Really not impressed with this
votesTotal: especially considering that we got quite an amazing amount of quality-shmups on Steam these days. Skip it."
column17: 22 of 26 people (85%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Ridiculous difficulty spikes will have you replaying old levels dozens of times in order to get enough currency to upgrade your plane to what it needs to be in order to progress further. This wouldn't that big of a problem if the levels didn't feel so uninspired, most of them just play the same anyways. The controls feel very loose as well.
voteText: 14 of 16 people (88%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Pretty average arcade shooter. Entertaining for a short time until you have to grind.
4.5/10

Pros:
- Looks nice
- Interesting boss fights
- Decent music and voices
- Not particularly hard except bosses
- Some achievements working as side objectives
- Short levels for quick sessions

Cons:
- Grindy for upgrades and achievements
- Poor shmup mechanics except for bosses
- Not much bullet pattern except a few attacks, so you can't avoid everything even if you learn.
- Doesn't really matter if you're hit (except on bosses since they hit hard): it heals over time (or with power ups) and since there's not combo it doesn't interrupt anything.
- No health indicator except bullet impact and cracked screen.
- 3 pilots but you probably won't bother using the 3.
- One pilot (Freshman) almost unplayable once upgraded: you can increase his movement speed, and once maxed it's way too fast with a controller.
- Broken leaderboards (poor scoring method anyway, total kills" is just grinding)"
voteText: 7 of 7 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This is a fun little arcade shooter, similar to 1942 back in the days. I used to play that for hours on end and this game is a cool little trip down memory lane.

Aces of the Luftwaffe does a lot of things right in my opinion. You can choose from 3 different types of planes (once you have earned enough medals to unlock them), each with different strengths and weaknesses. The planes can be upgraded between missions, which is super important during the boss fights. And the sound is realy top notch, and the voice overs for the bosses are simply hillarious. it's also quite challenging.

Of course it also has some flaws. The graphics are, ...well very retro. While it does fit the style and will probably appeal to older guys like myself, I'm sure it's not for everyone. Also it can get quite chaotic, so when there are a lot of enemies coming your way it's easy to lose track of your own plane.

All in all though, I can absolutely recomend Aces of the Luftwaffe for this price.
voteText: 13 of 21 people (62%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: I would recommend it for 1$ price, but not for 5$. It is a simple shmup with cute graphics but mechanics that get boring very fast. In short sessions it is a blast at first and the game has nice boss fights which are the also the main problem here. Boss are very difficult (especialy the 'Flying Dragon') so you need to upgrade your plane to stand a chance against them, but... the upgrades cost money as to have your plane maxed out, requires ridicolous amont of replaying old levels which causes you grow sick of this game with boredom. I assume devs wanted to stretch the game time but they overdone it...\n\nIf you get this game on a sale and decide to play it, take my advice and invest in Beast plane from the start. It is the only plane that is reasonable upgrades, dont waste money on other planes as you will waste a lot of time...
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: Low rent mobile port
voteText: 13 of 24 people (54%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Suprisingly nice-looking port from mobile platforms. Gameplay MOSTLY of a moderate difficulty, with only a few bosses and levels presenting a hard challenge. I found my hands trembling from adrenaline rush when fighting bosses from Flight of the Dragon and Night over Europe, I must say :)

There is, however, a BIG problem with this game. Since it was originally designed to have micro-transactions, it has a progressively steep price for upgrades, which forces you to grind easier missions over and over again. Also, ingame currency is needed to unlock each successive chapter in story, which leads to even more grinding. While such approach is unfortunately acceptable on mobile, it translates badly to PC, especially since you don't even have an option to pay instead of grind here. However, the game keeps its save file in plain-text format, and it's very easy to edit it, so if you find yourself tired of grinding, just go ahead and give yourself 10000 medals :)

Despite the problems, I still give this game a thumbs up, because I had fun playing it.
voteText: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Nice soundtrack, nice graphics, very good controls. The shooting is happening automaticallly in this side-scroll SHMUP. The difficulty is balanced - neither too hard nor to easy. Defiitely worth it if you get it in a bundle like the Indiegala Friday #25 bundle which is on right now.

reviewText: It's furious, it's hard, and it's very rewarding. Love the music!\n\nControls need a little fine tuning (sensitivity is high on some game pads)
voteText: 1 of 7 people (14%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Nice old school shooter. The graphics are very retro and could be a little better but the game has quite a motivating gameplay since even if you fail a mission you have collected crosses to invest into new upgrades or even a new plane. So you probably have to do some grinding even if you beat the missions with the first try because you won't be able to get everything (even new missions) unlocked without replaying older missions. Also it features some interesting and tough boss battles.
voteText: 6 of 18 people (33%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: 1st off, got this game out of a bundle, it's not worth spending money on. It's an all right game, but it's super linear and pretty short. If you suck as hard as I do, you might be replaying some boss battles to earn enough of (insert name of in game currency here) to buy enough upgrades to make it through the game. The cost of the upgrades goes up dramatically with each purchase, but you should be done with the game long before you fully upgrade one of your planes. There is no real ending to the game, after you finish the last boss battle, you're just sent straight back to the menu as if it was just another fight, so there's no resolution, no Hooray! We won the war! WooHoo!" stuff going on
date: nothing. Unless I missed something... Which is the problem
recommended: I don't know if I'm missing something or if that's just it"
voteText: true

reviewText: Fun visuals and a fun game. However, too grindy to be a long-term play through. The cost per upgrade is similar to games that normally have a pay-to-win aspect.
